Articles.Content:
Voyage To Dres

I have finally landed on Dres, Scott Kerman was the first to set foot on Dres. Utilizing a 3 part mothership, it flew to Dres and back. Pictures:

Launch of the Command Module:

Launch of the Lander Module:

Command Module and Lander Module docked in space:

Docking the Propulsion Module:

Burn,Baby,Burn! (Escaping Kerbin, on the way to Dres):

Drifting outward from Kerbin:

Goodbye Kerbin:

Hey, Dres is here!:

Orbiting Dres:

Scott and Shepemy Kerman have boarded the Lander Module and undocked:

Slowin' Down:

Misson Picture!

it's all fun and games:

After taking the excess fuel from the lander module, redocking Propulsion Module:

Im outta here!

After a long drift through space, Home

Quite toasty in here:

Nothing can go wrong now!

No, seriously nothing can go wrong!

Eh, back after 3 years.

Well, I had my fastest ever reentry during this mission, 5km/sec, thats why i got so much flames.

The next logical destination, is a Jool Orbit and return (already sent a probe there)!

But, before that, time to work on my next space station!

MISSION SPECS

Time: 3 years

Reentry Speed: 5km/sec

Crew: Scott, Shepemy, and Chadlo Kerman

Craft Mass: ~60-70 tons

Ship: Dust Class Interplanetary Explorer: 1st of its class, Ship Specific Name: Horizon

Objective: Well, whaddda you think?

print("Misson End")

end

(Props for who gets this reference)

Very nice.

Please don't tease by saying "nothing can go wrong". That's very un-Kerbal.

Nicely done!

It's always fun to read mission reports like these. Some day I should go through that backlog of screenshots I've got and write up one myself.

Nicely done!

It's always fun to read mission reports like these. Some day I should go through that backlog of screenshots I've got and write up one myself.

I already have three missions planned out. I'm gonna do jool orbital, laythe orbital, and laythe landing.

If we could get Scott Kerman and Kurt Kerman on the same ship...

Good job! *awards Scott Kerman the Jebediah Medal for Exploration*
